intro: Althaea sintenisii, commonly known as the Sudanese marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in wetlands and marshes. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their mucilaginous properties.
